sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
In the below figure, it is given that \(\angle QRT = \angle STR = \angle UVR = 90 \degree\). If \(QR = x\) units, and \(ST = y\) units and \(UV = z \) units then prove that 
\[
	\frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{z}
\]
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " 
Suppose $RV = a$ units and $VT = b$ units. Then we have 
\[
	RT = a+b
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " 
Now, in triangle UVT and triangle QRT we have
\[
	\angle UVT = \angle QRT 
\]
\[
	\angle UTV = \angle QTR 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that 
\[
	\Delta UVT \sim \Delta STR 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{UV }{QR } = \frac{VT }{RT }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{z}{x} = \frac{b}{a+b}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Now, similarly, we can write $\Delta UVR \sim \Delta STR $.
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{UV }{ST } = \frac{RV }{RT }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{z}{y} = \frac{a}{a+b}
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
On adding the above two results, we get
\[
	\frac{z}{x} + \frac{z}{y} = \frac{a+b}{a+b} = 1
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{z}
\]"}, {"id": "s9", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{$\angle UVT = \angle QRT$, since, both are 90\degree, and \angle $ UTV = \angle QTR $, as both are the same angle.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Therefore, we can also write $\frac{UV }{QR } = \frac{VT }{RT }$, as ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional, in which after putting values we get $\frac{z}{x} = \frac{b}{a+b}$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Similarly, following the above given procedure, $\Delta UVR \sim \Delta STR $, thus, we can write \frac{UV }{ST } = \frac{RV }{RT }, as ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Putting values in the equation we get $\frac{z}{y} = \frac{a}{a+b}$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Simply adding we get $\frac{z}{x} + \frac{z}{y} = \frac{a+b}{a+b} = 1$.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon cross-multiplication we get $\frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{z}$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
